decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly building up a board presence and overwhelming your opponent with aggressive creatures. The key strategy involves using cards like Bonecrusher Giant, Lovestruck Beast, and Brazen Borrower to put pressure on your opponent early on, while also utilizing cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Llanowar Visionary to generate card advantage and keep the aggression going. Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast is a powerful threat that can cheat out big creatures like Koma, Cosmos Serpent, giving you additional ways to close out the game quickly.

The deck aims to use a combination of mill and control to disrupt the opponent's strategy while leveraging Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion for added value. Thieves' Guild Enforcer, Soaring Thought-Thief, and Ruin Crab are used to mill the opponent's deck, while removal spells like Power Word Kill, Mystical Dispute, and Heartless Act control the board. Drown in the Loch and Into the Story provide card advantage, with Agadeem's Awakening for graveyard recursion. The deck's mana base also includes Castle Locthwain, Temple of Deceit, Fabled Passage, Zagoth Triome, Clearwater Pathway, Swamp, and Island for consistency.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and maximizing damage output. It includes powerful creatures like Questing Beast and Lovestruck Beast, as well as versatile cards like Gemrazer and The Great Henge to support the aggressive strategy. The deck also features strong removal spells like Blizzard Brawl and Primal Might to maintain board control. With a mix of creatures and spells to deal damage quickly, the Mono Green Aggro deck looks to outpace opponents and secure victory.

This deck focuses on building a fast and aggressive board presence using powerful, efficient creatures like Questing Beast, Lovestruck Beast, and Kazandu Mammoth. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with creatures and pump spells like Blizzard Brawl and Ranger Class to clear a path for an all-out attack. The deck also includes some versatile cards like Gemrazer and Scavenging Ooze for additional utility. The key strategy is to establish board dominance early and maintain pressure throughout the game with a solid mix of creatures and combat tricks.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards that cycle to draw more cards and deal incremental damage to the opponent. By using cards like Rielle, the Everwise and Irencrag Pyromancer, alongside cycling cards like Flourishing Fox and Drannith Stinger, the deck aims to quickly build up a board presence and pressure the opponent. Zenith Flare acts as a finisher, dealing a significant amount of damage based on the number of cards cycled. The deck also includes protection and disruption spells to control the game tempo and maintain aggression.

The main idea of the deck is to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by controlling the board and generating card advantage through cards like Mazemind Tome and Omen of the Sea. Yorion, Sky Nomad is used as a companion to provide additional value and flexibility. The win condition of the deck is to slowly grind the opponent out of resources while also having the option to close out the game with Shark Typhoon or Lochmere Serpent.

The deck focuses on establishing control over the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and enchantments to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also utilizes flicker effects with Yorion, Sky Nomad to generate additional value from entering the battlefield triggers and to reset problematic permanents. The deck aims to maintain a strong board presence with creatures like Archon of Sun's Grace while controlling the pace of the game with a mix of card draw, tempo plays, and disruption. With a well-timed Yorion flicker, the deck can overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of threats and answers.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures like Winota, Joiner of Forces and Blade Historian. By utilizing cards like Elite Spellbinder to disrupt the opponent's strategy and cards like Minsc, Beloved Ranger to generate additional value, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and win the game through aggressive tactics. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Vivien, Monsters' Advocate and Kenrith, the Returned King provide additional utility and versatility to adapt to different game situations.

The main idea of this deck is to have a fast and aggressive playstyle by using efficient creatures with strong abilities. The deck focuses on building a board presence early on with cards like Swarm Shambler and Lovestruck Beast, while also having removal options like Blizzard Brawl and Primal Might to clear the opponent's threats. The inclusion of snow lands enables synergy with Faceless Haven and Ranger Class, providing additional threats and potential card advantage. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggression and utility.

The deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent by playing efficiently costed creatures and using pump spells to increase their power. It also includes disruption in the form of removal and fight spells to maintain control of the board. Faceless Haven provides additional versatility and Lair of the Hydra offers a mana sink for late game ramp. Snow-Covered Forests enable the use of Blizzard Brawl and can also help trigger landfall abilities for additional value. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless stream of threats while maintaining board control.

The deck focuses on control through a combination of removal spells and counterspells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also utilizes ramp spells to accelerate mana production and cast powerful late game threats such as Emergent Ultimatum. The deck includes a variety of card advantage engines to keep up with the opponent and ensure a steady stream of resources. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a powerful companion, providing additional value through blinking permanents for continuous advantage. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outclass the opponent in a long game.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Lovestruck Beast, and Brazen Borrower to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The inclusion of Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast allows for the deck to cheat out powerful threats like Koma, Cosmos Serpent. The deck also features some control elements like Disdainful Stroke and The Akroan War to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the mana base is optimized to ensure smooth mana production for the deck's game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Lovestruck Beast to pressure the opponent and control the board. It also includes Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to cheat out big threats like Koma, Cosmos Serpent. The deck contains versatile cards like Brazen Borrower and Esika's Chariot for flexibility and disruption. The mana base is designed to consistently hit all colors needed for the deck. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of fast creatures and powerful late-game threats.

This deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy, utilizing a mix of powerful creatures and disruptive spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strength lies in the efficient use of mana acceleration and card advantage provided by cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Llanowar Visionary, while cards like Lovestruck Beast and Bonecrusher Giant provide strong threats and removal. Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast serves as a powerful finisher, allowing for explosive plays by cheating out big threats like Koma, Cosmos Serpent. The deck aims to outpace and outmuscle the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying creatures and generating value through Winota's ability to cheat out more creatures and attack for a lethal blow. The goal is to swarm the board with creatures, trigger Winota's ability to put even more threats into play, and overwhelm the opponent with powerful attacks. Key cards such as Jaspera Sentinel, Elite Spellbinder, and Esika's Chariot help support this game plan by providing additional bodies on the battlefield and disrupting the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to be aggressive and explosive, aiming to win the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with creatures, especially Human Warriors, to take advantage of Winota's ability to cheat powerful creatures onto the battlefield. The deck includes cards that generate additional creature tokens, provide card advantage, and support Winota's ability to trigger multiple times in a turn. By overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful combat abilities, the deck aims to quickly close out the game before the opponent can establish their own board presence.
